column4: can anyone tell me - what's the package for the latest dev version of the ubuntu 2.6 kernel? so i can fold some drivers into it and compile them in
it depends what you're trying to do, exactly

trying to get madwifi drivers working to get my netgear wireless card working. have the drivers, but they're in code form - i have to put them into a 2.6 kernel tree and compile the kernel, i presume. so, i need the code for the latest ubuntu kernel
you're sure the ubuntu madwifi drivers won't work?

i can't get them, i type in apt-cache search madwifi and it comes up with the 'restricted modules' packages. i installed one, reset, etc, wifi card still won't work. don't know the name of the driver to modprobe even
if you don't know the name of the module, how would compiling them help?
but if they just give you the ach_pci et.c drivers, well then they're already getting autoloaded and not working anyway
well i presume i'll get some more information when i go in and configure the kernel
no, I don't think you will.  what sort of card is it?
linux-restricted-modules-2.6.10-5-686 is already the newest version.
i have a netgear 802.11g pci card, according to the ubuntu wiki it should have the ar5212 chipset (it does) and bring up an interface called ach or ap0 or something, which it hasn't and won't
someone suggested madwifi, i presume this is a different set of drivers. found a deb of them on the net, it unpacks to a tar.gz of the madwifi modules source in /usr/src/
will it ever? it has mkreiser4
is reiser4 in the mainline kernel?
